intro: Sisymbrium diffusum, commonly known as field radish, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and have a distinct odor. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, and it produces long, slender pods containing several seeds. Sisymbrium diffusum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
